channel.title: BBC News - Business

item.title: Covid-19: More testing sites for key workers to avoid isolation in England
item.description: Police, transport, freight and fire workers will be able to join the daily contact testing scheme.

item.title: Covid: The holiday makers having to self-isolate abroad
item.description: Some holidaymakers who tested positive for Covid while abroad are having to stay and self-isolate.

item.title: Covid: Food exemption scheme delayed until Monday
item.description: Iceland warns the move will not solve the issue of staff shortages in supermarkets themselves.

item.title: Covid: New testing plan will not work, warn firms
item.description: Industry body, the CBI, criticises government plans that allow some key staff to bypass the NHS Covid app.

item.title: Rail services face cuts as staff self-isolate
item.description: Operators say they may have to run fewer trains as more employees are hit by the "pingdemic".

item.title: Firm fined Â£2.6m for claiming clothes prevent Covid
item.description: Australian activewear company Lorna Jane is branded "exploitative" and "predatory" by a judge.

item.title: Rural vacuum for getting hold of cash
item.description: People living in rural areas have less chance of withdrawing or depositing cash nearby, research finds.

item.title: People splash out on food and drink for Euro 2020
item.description: Retail sales rose by 0.5% as millions stocked up on food and drink to watch the football tournament.

item.title: India Zomato: Shares of food delivery app soar on market debut
item.description: The firm's stock exchange listing sets the pace for other start-ups that are thriving in the pandemic.

item.title: Didi shares fall on reports China is planning penalties
item.description: The ride-hailing giant's shares are now down by more than 25% since their New York market debut last month.

item.title: Twitter and Snap add users as restrictions ease
item.description: The social media companies passed analysts' expectations with their latest financial update.

item.title: Fashion for Crocs continues to break records
item.description: The chunky shoe's sales nearly doubled in the three months to the end of June compared with last year.

item.title: How global conferences are using tech to stay in business
item.description: Moving events online kept the industry going during the pandemic and now they're here to stay.

item.title: Heatwave: The worst jobs to have when temperatures soar
item.description: Not all jobs are equal when it comes to working in extreme heat, but which are the worst?

item.title: Is there a solution to the hospitality staff crisis?
item.description: Aside from Covid and Brexit, are there other reasons for the shortage of hospitality workers?

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Four-day weeks are good for business'
item.description: CEO Joe Munns says giving his workers a three-day weekend makes them happier and more productive.

item.title: The little tech firm gunning for an airspeed record
item.description: Electroflight has built the E-NXT which it hopes will break the electric airspeed record.

item.title: Using plastic waste to help solve sand shortages
item.description: With construction sand in short supply crushed plastic is being used as an alternative.
